intro: Edwardsia toromiro, commonly known as the Toromiro tree, is a species native to the Galápagos Islands. It is a member of the Moraceae family, which includes figs and mulberries. The tree is characterized by its smooth, light-colored bark and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, greenish flowers that are followed by edible, round fruits. The plant plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food for local wildlife.
